Qase.notes: Always 'Qase' with capital Q in prose. Lowercase 'qase' is correct in code, env vars (QASE_MODE), package names (jest-qase-reporter), and imports.

TestOps.notes: Product name is 'Qase TestOps' (capital T, capital O, no space).

test case.notes: Two words with space. Not 'testcase' or 'test-case'.

test run.notes: Two words with space. Not 'testrun' or 'test-run'.

test case ID.notes: Full form preferred. 'case ID' is ambiguous. 'test ID' is ambiguous.

QaseID.notes: In headings like '## Adding QaseID', use compound word. In prose, prefer 'test case ID'.

qase.config.json.notes: Full filename when referring to Qase configuration file. Generic 'config' needs qualification.

reporter.notes: Qase packages are 'reporters', not 'plugins' or 'extensions'. Package names are like 'jest-qase-reporter'.

API token.notes: Uppercase 'API', lowercase 'token'. Two words with space.

reporter plugin.reason: All Qase packages are reporters. 'plugin' is redundant and inconsistent with package naming.

test ID.reason: Ambiguous - could mean test case ID or test run ID. Use full form.

config.guidance: Prefer 'configuration' in prose. 'config' is acceptable in code contexts, filenames (qase.config.json), and variable names.

ID.guidance: Always qualify: 'test case ID', 'run ID', 'project code'. Standalone 'ID' is ambiguous.
